html: FACT: Federal law, DOJ Regulation, and case law prohibits grand jury information from being released to Congress. Had I voted for the subpoena, I would have been voting to force AG Barr to do something ILLEGAL under federal law.
text: FACT: Federal law, DOJ Regulation, and case law prohibits grand jury information from being released to Congress. Had I voted for the subpoena, I would have been voting to force AG Barr to do something ILLEGAL under federal law.

html: FACT: Voting for Resolution vs. Subpoena are two different legislative actions with different scopes: One was subpoena and other a sense of Congress. The subpoena goes further than the Resolution.
text: FACT: Voting for Resolution vs. Subpoena are two different legislative actions with different scopes: One was subpoena and other a sense of Congress. The subpoena goes further than the Resolution.

html: FACT: The resolution I voted for outlines the DOJ's legal requirement in public filings and proceedings, for prosecutors to "remain sensitive to the privacy and reputation interests of uncharged third-parties"
text: FACT: The resolution I voted for outlines the DOJ's legal requirement in public filings and proceedings, for prosecutors to "remain sensitive to the privacy and reputation interests of uncharged third-parties"

html: Previous administrations have proposed delisting the gray wolf to preserve the original intent of the Endangered Species Act -- species recovery. States like Arizona have a better understanding of how to manage their native wildlife.
text: Previous administrations have proposed delisting the gray wolf to preserve the original intent of the Endangered Species Act -- species recovery. States like Arizona have a better understanding of how to manage their native wildlife.

html: Today, the House passed H.R. 6784, a bipartisan bill to delist the gray wolf, which the @USFWS has deemed recovered under the Endangered Species Act. This will allow individual states to manage the species within their borders, not the federal government.
text: Today, the House passed H.R. 6784, a bipartisan bill to delist the gray wolf, which the @USFWS has deemed recovered under the Endangered Species Act. This will allow individual states to manage the species within their borders, not the federal government.

html: Today's @HouseHomeland subcommittee hearing focused on internal threats in airline/airport security. I questioned witnesses on recent undercover operations by the FBI at airports to combat drug smuggling, including PHX Sky Harbor. We must be remain vigilant for insider threats.pic.twitter.com/0r6ZfWWMk9

html: Allowing illegal immigrants to vote in our elections, even at a local level, diminishes the voting power of U.S. citizens. I'm proud to cosponsor & vote for H.Res.1071 to condemn voting by non-citizens in local elections. I'm against illegal immigrants voting in our elections.
text:
Allowing illegal immigrants to vote in our elections, even at a local level, diminishes the voting power of U.S. citizens. I'm proud to cosponsor 
& vote for H.Res.1071 to condemn voting by non-citizens in local elections. I'm against illegal immigrants voting in our elections.

html: I voted for H.Con.Res.119 which expressed Congress’ disapproval of a #carbontax because it would be detrimental to our economy. A carbon tax is effectively a tax increase on those who can least afford it. Our economy is surging due to #taxreform & we don't need unnecessary taxes.
